trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with AirWatch | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with AirWatch | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use AirWatch with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use AirWatch with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and AirWatch.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and AirWatch.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: An AirWatch single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An AirWatch single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to AirWatch will be able to single sign into the application at your AirWatch company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to AirWatch will be able to single sign into the application at your AirWatch company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for AirWatch
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for AirWatch

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for AirWatch.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for AirWatch.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select AirWatch, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select AirWatch, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to AirWatch with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to AirWatch with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the AirWatch application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the AirWatch application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to AirWatch page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to AirWatch page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the AirWatch Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign in to your AirWatch application (e.g.: "https:// companycode.awmdm.com/AirWatch/Login?gid=companycode"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the AirWatch Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign in to your AirWatch application (e.g.: "https:// companycode.awmdm.com/AirWatch/Login?gid=companycode"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at AirWatch page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at AirWatch page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your AirWatch company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your AirWatch company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click Accounts, and then click Administrators.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click Accounts, and then click Administrators.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Settings menu, and then click Directory Services.
trans-unit.target: Expand the Settings menu, and then click Directory Services.

trans-unit.source: Click the User tab, in the Base DN textfield, type your domain name, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the User tab, in the Base DN textfield, type your domain name, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: To upload the downloaded certificate, click Upload.
trans-unit.target: To upload the downloaded certificate, click Upload.

trans-unit.source: In the Request section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Request section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Airwatch dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Single Sign On URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Airwatch dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Single Sign On URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into AirWatch, they must be provisioned into AirWatch.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into AirWatch, they must be provisioned into AirWatch.

trans-unit.source: In the case of AirWatch, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of AirWatch, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your AirWatch company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your AirWatch company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane on the left side, click Accounts, and then click Users.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane on the left side, click Accounts, and then click Users.

trans-unit.source: In the Users menu, click List View, and then click Add \> Add User.
trans-unit.target: In the Users menu, click List View, and then click Add \> Add User.

trans-unit.source: On the Add / Edit User dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add / Edit User dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Type the Username, Password, Confirm Password, First Name, Last Name, Email Address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Username, Password, Confirm Password, First Name, Last Name, Email Address of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other AirWatch user account creation tools or APIs provided by AirWatch to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other AirWatch user account creation tools or APIs provided by AirWatch to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the AirWatch **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the AirWatch **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
